thread.title: England's Chris Jordan heading to the Bangladesh Premier League
thread.title_full: England's Chris Jordan heading to the Bangladesh Premier League

title: England's Chris Jordan heading to the Bangladesh Premier League
text:
England's Chris Jordan heading to the Bangladesh Premier League 22 Oct 2015 11:01:56 
comments 
England bowling all-rounder Chris Jordan will participate in the Bangladesh Premier League after being drafted by the Sylhet Superstars. 
Jordan is slated to miss the beginning of the country's six-team domestic Twenty20 competition as it clashes with England's limited-overs matches in the United Arab Emirates. 
The third edition of the BPL gets under way on Sunday, November 22, with England completing the last of their three T20 matches against against Pakistan eight days later. 
Jordan could be called up for the South Africa tour but as the first Test does not start until Boxing Day in Durban, Jordan is likely to be available for Sylhet for the remainder of the competition, with the final on December 15. 
According to the Bangladesh Cricket Board website, the 27-year-old will be joined by Northamptonshire batsman Josh Cobb in the Superstars' dressing room, while veteran Kent all-rounder Darren Stevens has been selected by the Comilla Victorians, with Middlesex batsman Dawid Malan set to compete for Dhaka Dynamites.
